Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Always Show Kaseya Agent In System Tray
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Kaseya Power Pack.User Experience 2018-10-26.Windows.Manipulate Windows System Tray Icons

If.description: Procedure description: This example will make the Kaseya Agent always visible in the Windows System Tray down to the right. This cool tool was found at: hianz.wordpress.com Kaseya customer value: Simple way to make any system tray icon always visible. End user value: Easy access to the most used softwares in the system tray. Dependencies: Windows OS Usage: Schedule recurring or run now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Statement.description: For Windows 7, Vista and XP we need to download a different additional DLL, same name though.
Statement.name: GetURL

Statement.description: Ok, now we use "traymanager.exe" to pin our preffered icon to always visible. Read more here: https://hianz.wordpress.com/
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: We keep the tools in the Kworking folder for reuse in the future.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM.: Kasyea Agent System tray: Always visible.

For Windows 10, 8.1 and 8 we need to download a additional DLL.

Statement.name: GetURL

Statement.description: Ok, now we use "traymanager.exe" to pin the Kaseya user tray icon to always visible. Read more here: https://hianz.wordpress.com/

Statement.description: We keep the tools in the Kworking folder for reuse in the future.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM.: Webroot Agent System tray: Always visible.

Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Change Yes/No Buttons

Body.description:
Thsi is a sample procedure showing you how to use interactive YES/NO buttons in conversation with the customer. You can customize the output as the step one indicates. Each of the actions can trigger different sub procedures.
Kind regards The upstream Tech Team

Parameter.name: Message
Parameter.value: +++YES:Sure, why not!++++++NO:No way!+++Do you really want to do this?

Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Clean-up Auto Updates And Desktop

Body.description:
Description: This procedure will remove many annoying autostart features of common programs.
Dependencies: Windows OS.
Kaseya customer value: Enhances user experience.
End user value: Enhances the user experience.
Usage: Execute the procedure at any time. Requires reboot to take effect.
Report Parameters: Procedyre Log, "User Experience - Clean-up Auto Updates And Desktop Executed".
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is" No support included.

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Disable misc auto-run stuff.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Disable misc auto-run stuff.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Disable misc auto-run stuff.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Remove desktop link. English XP.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Remove desktop link. Swedish XP.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Adobe Reader: Remove desktop link. Vista & Windows 7, 8 ,10. All languages.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

If.description: Oracle Java JRE: Disable 64 bit auto-update registry values.
Oracle Java JRE: Removes the Java Update Scheduler app from the system.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: User Experience - Clean-up Auto Updates And Desktop Executed.

Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Custom Logon Welcome Message - Disable

Body.description:
Description: This procedure will remove the welcome message on Windows machines before logon if set.
Kaseya customer value: A quick way to remove previous welcome messages.
End user value: Remove outdated and annoying welcome messages.
Usage: Execute the procedure at any time.
Dependencies: Windows OS.
Report Parameters: Procedure Log, "Custom Logon Welcome Message Disabled"
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is" No support included.

Statement.description: Writes entry in the procedure log for easy reporting.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Custom Logon Welcome Message Disabled

Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Custom Logon Welcome Message - Enable

Body.description:
Description: This procedure will display a welcome message on Windows machines before logon.
Dependencies: Microsoft Windows operating system.
Kaseya customer value: Creates a source of information to the end customer. Enhance customer interactions and relations.
End user value: Creates a source of information from the IT service provider.
Usage: Execute the procedure at any time.
Report Parameters: Procedure Log, "Custom Logon Welcome Message Set To:"
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is" No support included.

Statement.description: Setting the caption of the message.
Statement.name: SetRegistryValue

Statement.description: Setting the content of the message.
Statement.name: SetRegistryValue

Statement.description: Writes a procedure log entry.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Custom Logon Welcome Message Set To: #message#

Procedure.name: User Experience - Windows - Pin Outlook Word Excel 2016 On Taskbar

If.description: Procedure description: This example pins the Word 2016 in the taskbar. Kaseya customer value: Simple way to create taskbar shortcuts. End user value: Easy access to the most used softwares in the taskbar. Dependencies: Windows OS, Office 2016 32bit. Usage: Schedule recurring or run now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Statement.description: Let's un-pin the "Word" shortcut from the taskbar. This is just for cleaning up any previous "Word" pins you may have deployed.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Now, let's pin the "Word" shortcut to the taskbar.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand
